channel.title: I've got a no-ip, and i've added the port to my firewall, what next?
channel.description:
Question in topic name says it all really...? I have got a no-ip address and set the port to be excepted in the firewall settings. I don't have a router im using an adsl speedtouch 330, and I was wondering how I get my server to connect from this no-ip, do I have to make it run from it somehow, because at the moment when I enter the no-ip address and try to connect from it, it fails to connect? Please explain thankyou.
Mankk.

item.title: I've got a no-ip, and i've added the port to my firewall, what next?
item.dc:creator: @Solid_snake1 Solid snake
item.description:
@Solid_snake1 wrote:

lol i dont no if this will help you but for me what i do is
get 2 mopars up when my no-ip stops working get on 2nd and log onto dif ip then log on and sign back onto urs it seems to work for me also dont x out no-ip let it sit on ur screen that also seemed to work but idk…

Read full topic
item.source: I've got a no-ip, and i've added the port to my firewall, what next?

item.title: I've got a no-ip, and i've added the port to my firewall, what next?
item.dc:creator: @killyalater killyalater
item.description:
@killyalater wrote:

if youre trying to connect to your own server you dont need a server ip. just leave it blank and it will sign into your server

Read full topic

item.title: I've got a no-ip, and i've added the port to my firewall, what next?
item.dc:creator: @mankk mankk
item.description:
@mankk wrote:

It is…but still it doesn’t always work…could this be the client? Should I just restart it?

Mankk.

Read full topic
item.source: I've got a no-ip, and i've added the port to my firewall, what next?

item.title: I've got a no-ip, and i've added the port to my firewall, what next?
item.dc:creator: @Deadmeat Deadmeat
item.description:
@Deadmeat wrote:

Make sure you have no-ip running. IT HAS to be running in order to connect using no-ips.

Read full topic
item.source: I've got a no-ip, and i've added the port to my firewall, what next?

item.title: I've got a no-ip, and i've added the port to my firewall, what next?
item.dc:creator: @mankk mankk
item.description:
@mankk wrote:

TCP, ok update: It sometimes works and not at others…which isn’t very useful for people trying to connect to my server, so is there a way of getting it to work all the time…Cause while the server is running I try and log in through no-ip and it doesn’t work half the time. Answers will be good thanks.

Mankk.

Read full topic

item.title: I've got a no-ip, and i've added the port to my firewall, what next?
item.dc:creator: @mankk mankk
item.description:
@mankk wrote:

Yeah how do I host it? Because atm im loading up my no-ip thingy, typing the address into the mopar client and using the 43594 port but it says error connecting, when I try again connect…? Do I need to create a new account after I’ve been using my old one on the localhost for so long?

Or will this happen to everyone…

Thanks.

Mankk.

Read full topic
